column4: Hello, I hope somebody can help me with this. I'm getting a little desperate. No wifi detected on my MSI U135 (RaLink RT 3090). It worked fine till an update on July 6th. ubuntu 10.04.
Have you tried booting into a previous kernel?
I'm not sure how to do that.
Hold shift during boot and you will get a menu allowing to to select older kernels.
thanks. Will try that and return.
yess, I'm on wireless now... So how do I roll back the latest kernel - or is there another solution?
First file a bug report stating that support stopped working with the kernel update. To file the bug report run "ubuntu-bug linux".
a script fixed the non-support of ubuntu 10.04 already, so the fix needs a fix...
What script? If you aren't using the built in drivers then you will probably need to recompile them each time there is a kernel upgrade.
I'm just BP, a total non-geek...no compiling for me, I'm afraid. *sigh*.
What script are you talking about.
a Danish ubuntu guru sent it to me... would you like me to forward it to you so you can check it out?
What happens when you run that script with the newest kernel?
